body: Agree. There are some bugs (https://github.com/envoyproxy/envoy/issues/30379#issuecomment-1786311451) but they are easy to fix upstream. Do we expect to turn-off SotW?

I would make the change tell clients to use delta. We will still have some SotW around for other clients (debug tools, grpc, etc) and for opt-out cases. Long term we should start reducing all SotW usage, and possibly get to disabling, but IMO we get most of the value from just changing the envoy client defaults. The code to support SotW isn't too onerous to keep around for a while
This seems reasonable with some of the exceptions you noted in your comment, specifically for debugging tools
I'd suggest turning it on for all the integration test first, but TBH still concerned it will be breaking users with it on in release.
